sentences.english: The clamour of the heavy traffic gave you a headache.
sentences.chinese: 來往車輛嘈雜的聲浪使人頭痛。

sentences.english: But criticism of the entire phenomenon is growing as well.
sentences.chinese: 但針對這個現象的批評聲浪也在增加。

sentences.english: Musharraf has unilaterally amended the constitution at the beginning of the week and caused strong objections and noises.
sentences.chinese: 穆夏拉夫本週初片面修改憲法，掀起極大的反彈聲浪。

sentences.english: All about us is noise and bramble.
sentences.chinese: 我們的周遭都是荊棘與嘈雜聲浪。

sentences.english: Until recent years, the government cracked down on any critics of the dam.
sentences.chinese: 直到近些年，政府纔將對大壩的批評聲浪壓制下去。

sentences.english: On rainy days ，Swimming in the sound.
sentences.chinese: 在雨天，我們在聲浪中游泳。

sentences.english: The voice of Huo mulberry is deep and low and vibrates, eyes are like to brightly shiningly have fire.
sentences.chinese: 霍桑的聲浪低沉而顫動，眼睛也像灼灼地有火。

sentences.english: But as the decision to strike drags on, anti-war voices begin to grow louder.
sentences.chinese: 攻擊行動拖宕日久，國內反戰的聲浪漸漸大了起來。

definition: could happen at any moment/on the verge
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
(of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
the state of play in an election/the current state of a candidate's campaign
a shout/fig. opinion or demand, esp. expressed by a group
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to bombard/to bomb/(fig.) to criticize/to roast
